basic.description: Central issues include: the distinction between language and speech; the syntax/semantics/pragmatics trio; reference, denoting, names and descriptions; meaning, truth and verifiability; realism and anti-realism; linguistic forms of pragmatism, behaviourism, idealism, etc.
basic.subject: PHIL
basic.title: Philosophy of Language

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite    PHIL250 or permission of the Department.
